title: Practice Community-Based Continuous Professional Development Program for Healthcare and Social Welfare Professionals

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Theories and Practical Experience in Healthcare and Social Welfare
context.additional_context: A course aiming to solve field problems and enhance expertise through Community of Practice (CoP)-based small group activities, applying project-based assessments with microlearning content accessible via smartphones

learning_goals: Through community of practice activities, learners identify one field problem in healthcare/social welfare (e.g., lack of accessibility to elderly care services in local communities) and submit a finalized one-page (A4) action plan (including goals, strategies, resources, evaluation methods) incorporating at least three peer/expert feedbacks
Interprofessional collaboration competencies are strengthened through small-group collaboration and action learning.

Learners use mobile learning platforms (e.g., LMS apps, Padlet) to write daily self-reflection journals (200+ characters) for one week and exchange feedback at least once with two peer learners on a knowledge-sharing board

resources: Mobile Collaboration Tools (e.g., KakaoTalk Open Chat/Google Docs)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
